Message.Title: Intel to promote Haswell platform at IDF San Francisco
Message.Msg: From Digitimes: Intel is set to host its Intel Developer Forum (IDF) in San Francisco from September 11-13 and the company expects more than 4,000 IT industry-related visitors to participate at the show. Topics such as datacenters, embedded platforms and Intel's next-generation Haswell platform will be the major segments Intel will be promoting. Several high-level executives from Intel including David Perlmutter, executive VP and General Manager of Intel Architecture Group, are expected to deliver speeches related to Intel's technology outlook at the show. Intel is also expected to explain more about its upcoming Haswell processors and will be promoting the CPUs' 10W power consumption design to further improve battery longevity and to allow thinner and lighter industrial designs for ultrabooks.

Message.Title: Right-wing party loses to cyber squatter
Message.Msg: From Fudzilla: A right-wing born-again Christian political party, which is calling for a Taliban style of religious government in New Zealand, is probably wishing that the Internet rules were a little less harsh. Family First New Zealand is a political party which is anti-gay, anti-women's rights in fact anti-anything which is not mentioned in Deuteronomy. It claims that a “family friendly perspective with an emphasis on the Judeo-Christian values have benefited New Zealand for generations”. Ironically their logo is a koro which is an ancient Maori symbol for new beginnings, growth and harmony. Pagan symbols which represent new beginnings are not something you would usually expect from a conservative right group, which looks back to days when you could kill people and their goats for miffing your God. Family First New Zealand recently collected 50,000 signatures in desperate bid to stop the country allowing gay marriage. They handed out lots of slips with their domain name on so that people could read all about the terrible things that gays would do if they were legally allowed to be married. Unfortunately it seems that God, or the Devil, was against them. Someone in Family First New Zealand forgot to pay their domain name bill and the website listed on the slips was suddenly up for grabs. This was spotted by the pro-Marriage Equality movement which bought [withheld by Yahoo], they are automatically redirected to [withheld by Yahoo]. There instead of the usual calls to stone gay people in the public square for failing to act according to the will of a loving god, they can read a whole lot pro-marriage equality content. Cyber squattering is normally annoying, but it is nice when the forces of darkness finally get a kick in their intolerances.

Topic.Title: Who's better of today then when they bought Intel at 70 under Bill Clinton !?

Message.Msg: On December 21, 2000, just before adjounment, the Republican Congress passed and Clinton signed the 900-page Commodity Futures Modernization Act of 2000. There is a paragraph on page 219 that creates the credit default swap and puts control under the commodites exchange (Senator Grassley requirement) rather than the SEC. "Mr. EWING (for himself, Mr. COMBEST, Mr. LEACH, Mr. LAFALCE, and Mr. BLILEY) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committees on Banking and Financial Services, Commerce, and the Judiciary, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned" This bipartisan bill also generated the Enron loophole. If Senator Grassley had allowed credit derivatives to located under the SEC where they belonged, the damage would have likely been less. If you want to assign "blame" beyond those who lobbied for derivatives, then I would put high on my list: Lobbyist who pushed for credit derivatives Republican House (esp. Agriculture Committee Chairman) Republican Senate (esp. Agriculture Committee Chairman) Democratic President Clinton IF GWB had appointed strong regulators to Commodity Futures Trading Commission's (CFTC), the problem could have been reduced. The financial panic was a bipartisan effort where many players could have taken a stand and stopped it.

Message.Msg: Not at all what was said. Have you any reading comprehension capabilities whatsoever? It was very bullish. This is what the ML guy said: 'Next-gen chip manufacturing has become a 3-horse race between Intel, TSMC and Samsung, with Intel holding a 1 to 4 year lead, in our view. As we saw in 1H12, foundries were unable to ramp 28nm capacity, leading to product delays. Rising costs/ complexity (tri-gate) could further widen this gap. We believe this could enable Intel to gain a foothold (vs. zero today) in mobile over the next 2 years, as smartphone/tablet vendors look to Intel as a second or even primary source […] We firmly believe in Intel’s ability to reliably produce the lowest cost and highest performance silicon can help it maintain a dominant position in servers/data centers (20% of sales, 10-15% CAGR), and transition from legacy PCs to next-gen smartphones, tablets, Ultrabooks and other converged devices in the next 1-2 years. Message.Title: His Finest Hour
Message.Msg: From the Washington Times, no less: Bill Clinton took apart the Republican Party’s positions, plank by plank, revealing that there is no foundation for what they or their candidates say. It was a masterful job and in his down-home, conversational tone, Bill Clinton made the vast arena smaller and brought us at home into the conversation as he dismantled every Republican argument, shaking his head and sometimes his finger in disbelief. It was maybe Clinton’s finest hour as a speaker. Perhaps his best line — there were so many —was when he said it outright, yes, it was the Republicans who destroyed the economy and now heckle President Obama that he hasn’t fixed it already, saying: “We left a mess. He has not cleaned it up fast enough, so put us back in.”

Message.Title: No wonder HP ditched ARM for Intel Server Technology
Message.Msg: Intel Processors and Xeon Phi Co-Processors Promise to Power World's Most Efficient HPC Data Center 06/09/2012 02:08 (12:31 minutes ago) The FINANCIAL -- Signaling its commitment to energy-efficient high- performance computing, Intel Corporation announced that it will work with HP to help design and provide the U.S. Department of Energy's National Renewable Energy Laboratory with a supercomputing system that will drive research across a number of energy-related initiatives, including renewable energy and energy-efficient technologies.

Topic.Title: No wonder HP ditched ARM for Intel Server Technology

Message.Msg: The $10 million system, which will include about 3,200 Xeon processors and another 600 or so Xeon Phi coprocessors and include various ProLiant servers from HP, will eventually offer total peak performance of more than 1 petaflop (a thousand trillion floating-point operations per second) while driving up the energy-efficiency rating of NREL’s data center. Installation will begin in November, with full compute capacity coming online in the summer of 2013, according to the chip maker.

INTC is the leader in next-gen PC chip manufacturing, and INTC management looks to be aggressively positioning INTC to do the same for smartphone/tablet chips. INTC foundries have proven their superior ability to reliably crank out complex, low-cost new chips - and this strength, once fully applied to mobile, will build INTC mobile market share, IMO........... As Merrill Lynch analyst Vivek Arya noted today, "Intel’s ability to reliably produce the lowest cost and highest performance silicon can help it...transition from legacy PCs to next-gen smartphones, tablets, Ultrabooks and other converged devices in the next 1-2 years"............ yes analysts are cutting near term growth estimates as PC sales slow, but INTC mobile chips will be coming out in a bevy of new smartphones soon, and this is just the start for intel- management is smartly moving production towards the fast growth mobile space and this should move should generate significant future growth for INTC.......... INTC looks like a solid slow-growth, low priced (P/E 10, PEG 0.87, extra cash for buybacks), 3.7% dividend stock for these recessionary times. INTC will be a less volatile, more steady stock than QCOM, IMO........... I'm looking to sell OTM puts for income and to buy shares (via selling ITM puts to be put to with lower basis) on dips with spikes in VIX to develop a position , then sell OTM covered calls to juice the dividend

Perhaps you need to read some communist classics so you can learn what communism is. Having lived in a communist country, I can assure you that you have no idea what you are talking about.

Someone once asked Andy Grove, when Intel was the 4th largest semiconductor company, "what will Intel have to do to move up the list and become 3rd, 2nd and 1st?" Andy Grove responded that if Intel wanted to be the largest company the next day, they could simply walk out to the curb and sell $100 bills for $99 each. Intel could remain the most profitable company and become the largest semiconductor company by revenue. The point is that Intel margin has increased due to shrinking Atom sales and they have the MCM costs incorporated in their plans. Intel will not flood the market, Intel WILL, however, set a strategic price watermark that will pressure exisitng vendors. MCM module costs are well understood and won't be a problem.

I like the selling the ATM puts. The put options have the dividend premium adder and are easy to roll. The spread is never more than 2 cents and they seem to bring in about 20 to 30 cents per month. Even at several dollars ITM, you can roll in the 15 to 20 cents per month. I like!!

"Bill Clinton did a great job selling Bill Clinton." [No, he did a great job selling the idea of supporting the middle class. ] "As for the current president, he didn't convince me." [Yeah, he explained why. You can't do arithmetic...] "He has a marginal track record" [As Clinton said, no one could have fixed the incredibly mess Obama started with - in four years...] "his campaign is far more left leaning this time and he's setting himself up to be a lame duck president if he gets a second term." [Empty, meaningless Romney/Ryan rhetoric which is all you have when you have no detailed plans to fix anything...] "Of the two major parties he was the best candidate last go around. This time he isn't." [When your guy comes up with a plan to fix the economy you let me know. We're going to have (another) big tax cut and then figure out how to pay for it is not a plan...] "A middle class tax cut with far higher taxes on the wealthy doesn't sound like fair, it sounds like class warfare." [The deadbeat rich have gotten tax cut after tax cut. What was fair about that? Bush started two wars. And the rich still got more tax cuts. Time for the rich to quit bleeding the middle class and pay their fair share. Quit holding your hands out for more tax cuts and quick whining about fairness. Romney deducts water melon for his horse and pays a lousy 13 percent on millions. The rich are destroying America with their greed...] "The pseudo-hippie message has gone on too long. Compared to Clinton Obama is a liberal extremist." [More empty rhetoric. Come back when you have the details on how to grow jobs. And don't make me laugh by saying trickle down, more tax cuts for the rich and less regulation. We've tried those under every Republican president in the last 30 years. They all blew out their budgets.] "Obama wants to run on a platform, but I will hold him to his record, and it sucks!" [Yeah, a real shame Obama can't fix the mess you created any faster...]

"MCMs cost more than SOCs...." *** But sending a shill from the ARM marketing department to post smack on the Yahoo message boards is FREE!!! And considering the crisis in ARM fabrication it is unlikely there will ever be money for a real marketing campaign!

Message.Title: Intel forum is next front in x86 vs. ARM war
Message.Msg: SAN JOSE, Calif. – Next week's Intel Developer Forum is shaping up as the next front in the battle over who will own the cloud and who will own the mobile client. During IDF in San Francisco, Intel will roll out new client and server products and initiatives to defend its turf in everything from ultrabooks to exascale supercomputers. It also will try to grab some territory in hot mobile markets like smartphones, tablets and the Internet of Things were it lacks a firm foothold today. Arch-rivals Advanced Micro Devices and ARM are setting up flanking actions all across the same terrain. Here’s a bit of what it looks like from our vantage point. Monday (Sept 10), AMD will host a press event to provide the first details about what it will do with the server technology it acquired with SeaMicro. We already know SeaMicro’s interconnect will form the basis of a follow on to HyperTransport AMD will name Freedom Fabric and try to make an industry standard for an ecosystem of x86 and ARM chips—a key plank for building big data center systems of all sorts As AMD prepares its advance, Intel is inviting press to a small group dinner Monday night with one of the heads of its server business. It has also put together a pre-briefing on its interconnect plans that will be announced Monday (Sept. 10). Intel’s acquisitions of Cray’s interconnect group and the Infiniband business of QLogic telegraphed Intel’s plans. Clearly, the company aims to bolster the proprietary Quick Path Interconnect on its processors to link clusters of CPUs for high performance computing and other uses in the cloud. The engineers at Hot Interconnects recently devoted a whole panel to speculating on Intel’s plans and their implications. At the panel a representative of the RapidIO trade group said it is pitching its technology as a standard for use on ARM server SoCs.

Topic.Title: Intel forum is next front in x86 vs. ARM war

Message.Msg: AMD? 3 dollar stock headed towards being delisted. What a crap company. Seriously.

Message.Title: Joe Biden total goofball idiot
Message.Msg: Wow, awful speech. Yelling at us like we are kids, making outlandish statements that Mitt and Ryan were betting against the US people ??? Just a total tool. Why are Liberals ALWAYS tools??

You were probably watching the Foxnews version with the special custom editing. It was specially prepared for the non-Liberal viewers by Sean Hannity. Sean is very good at editing tapes to prove a point. He is the greatest. He probably saved you from having to see the uninteresting liberal parts.
"Real men don't use multiple aliases" - Wallisweaver 2012 (as he uses multiple aliases) Hey Wally.............real men also don't say "prolly" and "specially". What a lazy liberal hypocrite freak.

Amazing! You can read. Since I am not Walty, you will have to address your comments to him. The names you call him may be accurate but you are not any better. Likely, much worse. I would be angry too if I was a poor, white, conservative, middle aged man. Just the thought of a "goofball idiot" and "black, foreign, muslim liberal" beating the best white men that the Republican Party can find. Quite pathetic. Take a deep breath and exhale slowly several times and you will feel better. Chill out before you hurt yourself!

It was a mistake to have Clinton last night. He was a much better speaker. He was a much better President. All I can see now is how much worse off we have it. BTW, when did illegal aliens go to becoming just aliens, and now dreamers? If I rob a bank, can I say that I am not a criminal, but just a guy who is part of the 99% who is into wealth redistribution?
